dialogue.message: Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Thank you. I'm wanting to watch a film with some friends all around the age of 50
Is there anything that you would like to avoid watching?
Please avoid horror ilms
What genre of movies is your favourite?
We all enjoy psychological thrillers
Do you prefer modern or older films?
Modern please?
are you looking for something dark or lighter hearted?
Something light-hearted please

Based on your preferences for something fairly modern and a psychological thriller , I think you and your friends would enjoy 'The Sixth Sense' https://www.bing.com/search?q=the+sixth+sense&cvid=f746a86a4f284257a26d8aa4a8ae743c&gs_lcrp=EgZjaHJvbWUqBggAEAAYQDIGCAAQABhAMgYIARAuGEAyBggCEAAYQDIGCAMQABhAMgYIBBAAGEAyBggFEAAYQDIGCAYQABhAMgYIBxAAGEAyBggIEAAYQNIBCDQxMzVqMGo0qAIAsAIA&FORM=ANAB01&PC=SCOOBE
Please let me know what you think?
I think that's a good option. Thanks
What is it that appeals to you about 'The Sixth sense?'
Looks like my thing. A psychological thriller with a great cast and no horror!
I'm glad you like my suggestion. I hope you enjoy the film and I look forward to helping you again sometime. Is there anything else I can do for you today?
No, that's great Thanks for your help
Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hi I would like a recommendation for a christmas film
Christmas is a perfect time to watch Christmas films. I just need to ask a few questions so I can find the perfect film for you, is that ok?
Yes that is fine
Ok great what kind of genre do you prefer for your Christmas film and who are you watching the film with?
I am watching a film with my children, and would like a funny  film
How old are your children?
10 and 12 years old

Thank you, would you be happy with films rated PG and under? I would recommend:

3. Home Alone (1990)
PG | 103 min | Comedy, Family

An eight-year-old troublemaker, mistakenly left home alone, must defend his home against a pair of burglars on Christmas Eve.

Director: Chris Columbus | Stars: Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, John Heard

 It is ranked 3rd best Christmas comedy film by Imdb
That sounds really good, have you any more choices?

Glad you liked that choice , you can find our more at:

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0099785/?ref_=ttls_li_tt

I have another choice for you and it is:

 Elf (2003)
PG | 97 min | Adventure, Comedy, Family

Raised as an oversized elf, Buddy travels from the North Pole to New York City to meet his biological father, Walter Hobbs, who doesn't know he exists and is in desperate need of some Christmas spirit.

Director: Jon Favreau | Stars: Will Ferrell, James Caan, Bob Newhart, Zooey Deschanel

You can find out more information by following this link:
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0319343/?ref_=ttls_li_tt
Thank you but the kids have seen Elf, have you any others you can reccommend?

Thank you for letting me know and I can recommend the following film

The Santa Clause (1994)
U | 97 min | Comedy, Drama, Family


When a man inadvertently makes Santa fall off his roof on Christmas Eve, he finds himself magically recruited to take his place.

Director: John Pasquin | Stars: Tim Allen, Judge Reinhold, Wendy Crewson, Eric Lloyd

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0111070/?ref_=ttls_li_tt

It is a lovely comedy and suitable for yourself and your children
That is a great choice thank you as I like Tim Allen and find him funny and love the idea of the film
That is great that you like it but I can offer more choices if you require. What do you like about the film and Tim Allen?
I have seen other Tim Allen films and find him funny. The children love the idea of some one's dad becoming Father Christmas slowly over the year
Thank you for telling me all that information and is lovely to know that I have the ideal film for you and your children. Hope you enjoy the film
Thank you too for your help
I am here to help with your choices at any time
Please help just started watching the film and one of my children has said they have seen it, was their a sequel?
HI I have just started watching the film but my children have said they saw it in school the other day. Is there a sequel?

HI yes there is a sequel called The Santa Clause 2 starting Tim Allen who you like. You can find more details at https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0304669/?ref_=nv_sr_srsg_1_tt_7_nm_0_q_the%2520santa%2520claus%25202

Scott Calvin has been a humble Santa Claus for eight years, but it might come to an end if he doesn't find a Mrs. Claus.

Director
Michael Lembeck
Writers
Don Rhymer,Cinco Pau,lKen Daurio
Stars
Tim Allen, Spencer Breslin, Elizabeth Mitchell

This film is ideal for you as it stars Tim Allen who you like, and is a christmas  comedy that is suitable for all the family
Thank you that is ideal and will check it out, did Tim Allen do any more christmas films?

Yes Tim Allen made a number of Christmas films that I feel you would enjoy with your children. They are

The Santa Claus 3 which is the sequel to The Santa Clause 2 that I recommended.

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0452681/?ref_=nm_flmg_t_28_act

Santa, a.k.a. Scott Calvin, is faced with double-duty: how to keep his new family happy and how to stop Jack Frost from taking over Christmas.

And the other Film is 
Christmas with the Kranks

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0388419/?ref_=nm_flmg_t_32_act

With their daughter, Blair, away in Peru, Luther and Nora Krank decide to skip Christmas all together until she decides to come home, causing an uproar when they have to celebrate it at the last minute.

Both of these films are Christmas Comedies and suitable for you and your Children Yes he did two more, would you like to find out more details?
Thank you but that is perfect what you sent me
I am glad that I was able to find the films that you like
done
What is it that you like about Tim Allen christmas films? This helps me make better choices for the future
I like his humour, and I like films that give me a good feeling at christmas, fill me with Christmas Spirit, films that I can watch with the children
Christmas is such a special time for all the family. Thank you for helping me to understand what you are looking for
You have been so helpful thank you
Hi the kids have gone to bed and I am alone now. What film would you recommend?
Hello, would you still want to watch a film with Tim Allen as you have said you like his films?
Yes please and maybe a christmas one that is more adult
Is there a special reason why you would a more adult christmas film?
Yes it is nearly christmas and I love christmas themed movies

Thank you for the information and I would recommend 

El Camino Christmas
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt3255590/?ref_=nm_flmg_t_9_act

Eric comes to El Camino looking for his unknown dad. He's harassed, hit and jailed by a drunk local cop, who later shoots at a liquor mart with Eric +4 inside. The sheriff and deputy then shoot up the place, answering each other's fire.

I have recommended it as stars your favourite actor and is comedy set at Christmas. How do you feel this is suitable for you?
Oh wow this perfect and does sound ideal as it is a film I have not seen or heard of before
What appeals to you about this film? Your answers help me make better choices in the future
I love finding films I have not heard of before plus stars one of my favourite actors. It is also set at christmas and a comedy so ticks every box for me

Thank you for taking the time to explain your thoughts and feelings, and helps me to learn more about your likes and dislikes. Hope you have enjoyed chatting with me and look forward to chatting with you again
Thank you and yes I have enjoyed chatting with you and liked your film choices

movie_like: films not seen or heard of before

dialogue.message: Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
I'm looking for some sci-fi films to watch with my whole family which includes people aged 12 - 45. Have you got any recommendations for me?
Do you have any specific content restrictions or things you would prefer to avoid in movies?
Yes please, I would prefer to avoid any type  of blood and gore as my young son doesn't like to see that sort of thing.
Can you give me more detail on the ages of the viewing companions you are planning to watch the film with and their preferred movies within ghr sci-fi genre?

Sure, no problem. There are 5 people who are going to be watching the film.  My 12 year-old son, my 15-year old daughter, my 21 year old niece and me and my wife - both 41 years of age. We love the Star Wars franchise.
Are you looking for modern or more historic sci-fi movies to watch?
Some recent releases would be ideal as I have watched most of the earlier sci-fi films.

Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse sounds like it would be the perfect film to meet your requirements. Find a link to the IMDB page below:

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt9362722/?ref_=sr_t_1
Looks very interesting. What is the length of this film?
The film is listed as being 2h 20m in length. Is this acceptable to what you are looking for?
Yeah, that film sounds and looks great. Thank you so much for your help.
No problem at all. Thank you for your co-operation and patience and I am glad I could be of service today.
Brilliant, thank you again for your help.
Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hi! I'm trying to think of a movie to watch tonight by myself but I'm struggling to find one that I want to watch as there are too many options! Can you help?
I'm more than happy to assist! To help me gather a better idea of what move will suit me, I want to ask if you have any specific content restrictions or things you really want to avoid watching?
Thanks for asking! My only restriction is that I don't want to watch any horror movies as I dislike gore and ghosts!

Thanks for letting me know! So what are your favorite movie genres - do you like romance, action, etc? Also, have there been any movies recently that you really enjoyed watching that you would like to see more of? Looking forward to your answer!

My favourite genres do tend to be romance, comedy, action and movies like that! I really prefer a happy ending to my movies as well! I recently watched Black Widow and I really enjoyed that - the family dynamics were amazing!

Do you have any movies that you like watching often or rewatching? Also, are there any directors or actors who you absolutely love watching and want to see more of? If you have any preference for the language of the movie or the region it comes from, let me know!

I love rewatching Khabi Khushi Khabi Gum and Avengers Assemble! I also really like Florence Pugh as an actress but I don't have a preference beyond that! Also, I would prefer movies in English but other than that I don't mind!

Taking into account your genre preferences and love for Florence Pugh, I would recommend Little Women (2019) https://www.imdb.com/title/tt3281548/. It comes highly recommended with the incredible Greta Gerwig as director! It is not the happiest ending but is a heart-warming and incredible coming-of-age drama that resonated with many which is why I recommended it! What do you think of my choice?
Ooh, I've heard a lot about this adaptation and Greta Gerwig's talent as a director so I'm very excited to give it a go! Thank you for your recommendation, I'm really pleased with it!
I'm happy to hear that! What are you looking forward to it, is there any aspect that you think will be specifically enjoyable?
I know the plot vaguely and know it is enough of a happy ending to please me and it has my favourite actress in so I'm looking forward to that!
Thank you so much! I enjoyed working with you and hope you like the movie tonight!
Thank you!
Hi! I would like to watch another movie by Florence Pugh as I really love her acting! I don't mind if it is not a happy ending this time though :) I just want to watch more of Florence Pugh!
Do you have any preference for seasonal themes in films, like now we're near Christmas, would you like a Christmas movie?
No, I don't mind and have no seasonal preferences; I don't tend to watch many Christmas movies!
Are you watching alone tonight or are you watching with someone else?
I'm watching alone tonight so no one else to worry about!

So taking into account your preference for Florence Pugh movies and your willingness to explore different endings, I'm going to recommend Don't Worry Darling. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt10731256/ This is an intriguing thriller/mystery that has captured the internet's attention - people have raved about Florence Pugh in this role so I think you'll enjoy it! What do you think about this suggestion?

I think this sounds amazing! I know Florence Pugh hasn't acted in many of the genres I preferred so I'm definitely willing to branch out! I'm looking forward to trying something new and seeing her performance in this movie!
Is there anything that interests you in particular about seeing Florence Pugh in a different genre of movie?
She was amazing in everything I've seen her in so far, I'm really excited to see her skill as an actress in a thriller and see how she adapts to this role! Thank you for your help!
Hey! I'm going to be travelling with my mother and brother and was hoping you could help us find a movie we can all watch together on the way there and will enjoy!
I'm more than happy to help! Do your mother or brother have any restrictions on what they will watch or genres that they want to avod?
So neither like horror or very heavy dark movies! Also topics of abuse and rape should be avoided.

So for a movie that is light-hearted and suitable for the whole family, I would recommend Into the Spider-verse which is an action movie. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4633694/. I think this works perfectly with your genre preferences as it is action centred and has moments romance and comedy throughout! What do you think of this suggestion, would this work for your purposes?

I think this sounds amazing! It has all my favourite genres in one and sounds really interesting! I think something light-hearted and animated would work brilliantly with my family and tackle our entertainment on our journey!
Is there anything specific about the movie that appeals to you? What about Into The Spider-Verse in particular do you think your mother and brother will enjoy?

I love the fact that it combines action and comedy as that always suits my tastes! I also think that an animated film is always nice to watch will the family and they'll enjoy the comedic aspect while the action will catch their attention.
I'm really happy you liked the suggestion! Thank you for your constructive and uplifting feedback, I really hope you and your family enjoy the movie!
Thank you!
Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hello, can you recommend me a good action film to watch tonight?
Sure, do you have any content restrictions to bear in mind? Are there any topics I should avoid?
No, im watching by myself so anything highly rated will do
Do you have any favourite actors I should include in the search?
I do like Idris Elba
He is a very good actor, can I ask, are you in a good mood, do you want something dark and gritty or something a bit lighter?
The darker the better thanks!

I found a movie which you may enjoy! Rocknrolla directed by Guy Ritchie. A Russian mobster in London orchestrates a crooked land deal. 

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1032755/?ref_=nm_flmg_t_32_act
Many thanks, Guy Ritchie is a great director too!
What makes you like Guy Ritchie films?

His style is really good, the scene selection and music in his films are also great. All of his movies seem to be a massive web which all comes together in the end. They are generally really well written too.
Thats great! Thank you for giving me such insight - I'll use it for further recommendations for you.
Awesome, thanks for the recommendation
hello
Hi, I can recommend movies to you. Do you have any requests for a genre today?
another Guy Ritchie action movie would be great
Sure, are you watching alone or with friends?
Im alone
Do you have any preferences for the movie, any themes to avoid? The more information I can gather the better my recommendation will be.
No content restrictions or themes to avoid, anything is good for me
Do you normally watch comedy/thriller movies, do you like horror films?
Comedy is always appreciated in a film.

I think I found the perfect film for you. 

Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels - https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0120735/?ref_=nv_sr_srsg_0_tt_6_nm_2_q_lock%2520st

This film contains a lot of dark humour, and is a madcap tale about a card game gone wrong.
Many thanks, I'll look into it
Glad I could help, what interests you about this movie?
I love dark humour, so this should be right up my street
Thank you for your input, enjoy the movie!
thanks
Hello
Hi! Are you interested in watching movies alone or with friends?
Im with my family this evening
Thats great, are you celebrating anything special today?
No, but its near to a birthday so something light and entertaining would be good
Awesome, do you have a wide range of ages in the audience? Are there any topics or content I should avoid?
All of the audience are at least teenagers, and a comedy would be good, with no drugs in the film

I found a film which should be a good match

Chickn Run: Dawn of the Nugget - https://www.imdb.com/title/tt8337264/

Its a family friendly animation which is the sequal to Chicken Run.
Many thanks, my kids loved the first movie, this should be good.
Im glad I could help, thank you
thanks
You are very welcome, feel free to come back for more movie recommendations.
thank you
Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hello! I'm looking for a recommendation for a movie to watch this evening.
I'm more than happy to help. I would like to choose a movie that is suitable for you. Are there any age restrictions for the film? Are there any types of film that you do not want to see in the film?
No, there are no age restrictions. Everyone who watches the film will be an adult.  There's nothing that I specifically don't want to see but I'm not that interested in films set in space.
Great! Firstly, I would like to check whether you will be watching this movie on your own or with other people? Who will you watch it with? Do you have any genre preferences?
I will be watching the film with my boyfriend. I like romcom films but my boyfriend doesn't. We both enjoy horror films.

Great. What sort of mood are you in? This will help me to decide the type of film I suggest. Where do you plan to watch the film?

Lastly, which streaming platforms do you have access to?
I'm in a relaxed mood so we will spend the evening in our house to relax and watch a film. I'm in the mood to watch something that will make me jump. I have access to Netflix and Amazon prime video.

Thank you. I have thought of a film that I think you will enjoy. The film is called 'The Conjuring'.
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1457767/?ref_=nv_sr_srsg_0_tt_8_nm_0_q_The%2520conjuring

It was released 10 years ago but is very popular and considered to be a very scary film with a lot of jump scares. It is available to buy or rent on Amazon Prime Video. 

Does this look like a film you are interested in watching? Do you have any feedback on my choice of film?
Thank you for the recommendation. We have seen this film before and it was indeed very scary. We would like to watch it again though.
That is very interesting. I'm glad to know that my choice reflects your taste in horror films. Is there a specific reason that you are interested to watch it again?
I think overall it had an interesting storyline and I would be interested to watch it for any details that I might have missed the first time.
Thank you for you feedback. Your reasons for wanting to watch the film again are very interesting. Is there anything else that I can help you with today?
No, nothing else. Thank you for your help.
Hello! How are you today?
Hello! I am here to help you choose a movie. When do you prefer to watch films? Do you like to watch them at home or when you are travelling?
Thank you for your help. Sometimes I like to watch films while travelling, for example, on a long plane journey. Mostly I like to watch films at home or when I'm visiting friends or family.
Thank you for describing your preferences. What type of films do you enjoy? Why do you enjoy these genres?

I like to watch big blockbuster films. I also like to watch Romcom films and horror films. I like to watch films as a source of escapism. I enjoy the stories of blockbuster films and romcoms make me feel quite lighthearted.

Thank you for providing your preferences. 

Based on your preferred genre, I would suggest that you might like to watch the Barbie movie. 

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1517268/?ref_=nv_sr_srsg_1_tt_4_nm_3_q_Barbie

It was released in 2023 and was extremely popular. It was listed as being quite funny and would provide a sense of escapism that you expressed you enjoy. 

Do you have any feedback on my choice?

This looks like a great choice. I saw it advertised and did want to see it in the cinema but didn't have the chance. It looks very fun and like it would help me to escape from the real world for a few hours.

Great.

Is there a reason that you were particularly interested in watching this film?
It looks like it has a great cast of varied actors. I'm also interested in the work of the female director. It also had a great marketing campaign and the visuals from the film look fantastic.
Thank you for your feedback. I'm very glad that I was able to help you to choose a film today.
Thanks for your help!
Hello assistant! I'm looking for some help today with choosing a film to watch.
Good afternoon! I'm here to help. What is the reason that you will be watching the film? Will you be watching the film by yourself or with other people?
I'll be watching the film by myself. I'm feeling a bit low so I'm looking for a film to watch in bed this afternoon.
I will try to make a choice that will help you. What sort of film are you in the mood for? Are you interested in a new film or a slightly older one?
I think I'm in the mood for something dynamic and lighthearted. I really like films from the noughties, they give me a sense of nostalgia whilst being quite entertaining.

I will make the suggestion of watching the film 'The devil wears prada' 

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0458352/?ref_=fn_al_tt_1

It was released in 2006 and is quite lighthearted and funny. It is focussed around fashion and provides some good visuals. It also has lots of well-known and talented actors and actresses. 

Does this sound like a film that you are interested in watching?
That sounds like a great suggestion. It features Meryl Streep, one of my favourite actresses. It looks like it will provide a great sense of nostalgia.
Is there anything else about my suggestion that you look forward to in the film?
Not really. I just want to watch something that's easy viewing.
(Thank you for considering my suggestions. I hope you enjoy watching the film. Goodbye.
Bye! Thanks for your help!

users_mood: In the mood for something dynamic and lighthearted

dialogue.message: Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hi, I want to get a movie recommendation, I will be watching by myself.

I can certainly assist you with that today. If you have any content restrictions (i.e no scary films/adult movies, etc) then please let me know so that I can make sure I recommend the best movies suited for your needs.
I don't want to watch anything made in the past 20 years, other than that, I have no other restrictions
What movie genres do you prefer? For example you could answer, Horror, Action, Romance, Drama, Musical or any other genre you would like to see.
I like 80s horror films, I like the cliche psychopathic killer types of stories.
If you have a favorite actor/actress then please let me know. You can also tell me the names of any directors you like. With this I can ensure I give you a good recommendation!
My favorite actor is Terry O'Quinn

Based on what you've told me, I recommend the movie "The Stepfather" (1987), an 80s Horror movie, starring Terry O'Quinn. Since you mentioned that you like 80s horror films with psycopathic killer stories, this movie is a highly suitable match to your preferences.

Here is the IMDb link for the movie "The Stepfather" (1987): https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0094035/

Please let me know your thoughts on this recommendation!
That looks interesting, I will definitely watch this movie. A perfect recommendation thank you.
I'd love to know why you picked this movie! What specific aspect of the movie was the deciding factor in your choice?
Mainly because it features my favorite actor, Terry O'Quinn, and it looks like a great cheesy 80s movie.
Thank you for letting me know why you chose this movie, I am glad to have been of assistance today! If you ever need another movie recommendation, don't hesitate to ask!
I will now go and enjoy this movie. Thanks for your help!

content_restrictions: no movies from the last 20 years

dialogue.message: Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hi there, I am interested in all sorts of films but i especially like thrillers
Could you name some thrillers you have enjoyed?
Ive really enjoyed films such as Prisoners, Taxi Driver,  Talk to Me and The French Connection
Could i just ask who you mostly or will be watching films with? And do they share the same genre preference?
I mainly watch films alone, but sometimes i do watch them with my friends, they usually share my taste in these films.
What is it about thrillers you really enjoy? Do you have any specific actors or directors you follow in this genre?

I mean Thrillers is a large catagory so its hard to say for sure what i like about them. However im a fan of a darker tone. I find them very engaging and like to see the story unravel. I do actually, i really like what Brandon Cronenberg is doing with cinema lately as well as  Julia Ducournau. Im also really enjoying the work that Mia Goth is creating lately.

There are many films that fit in to the catagory of thriller, as well as films with a darker tone. However based on the directors and the actor you stated, there are two options i can happily suggest. Firstly is the film Raw(2016)( https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4954522/?ref_=nm_flmg_t_4_dr). I suggest this as it was directed by Julia Ducournau and is a dark thriller that was recieved well. Another suggestion would be Infinity Pool (2023) (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt10365998/) I also suggest this as it is also a strange thriller but also is directed by Cronenberg as well as starring Mia Goth.
They both look and sound interesting, would you suggest i watch them by my self?
Why do you usually watch films alone? Not that there is anything wrong with it, im just curious if there are specific reasons?

I would say its usually just easier as i am often alone on evenings, which is when i usually watch films. However sometimes its because people can be annoying whilst watching films and i like to focus.
That makes alot of sense, you sound like your really into films. Thank you very much for talking with me.
Thank you for the suggestions.
Is there anything else i can help you with?
Yes actually, could you suggest some other films starring Mia Goth or any upcoming projects i should be looking out for?
Hi there could you suggest another film starring the actor we previously talked about please?
Hi there, I can certainly suggest another film with said actor. Is there any type of film you would like to see her in? Will you be watching this alone as well?
Thank you. I dont really have a preference on the type of film, Im just happy to watch anything she  is in. Ill be watching it alone so dont worry about nudity or uncomfortable situations
Ok got it. Are there any other actors or directors you really enjoy that might help me make a suggestion? What sort of mood are you in today? Is there any topics or subject matter you dont like?

I enjoy alot of actors and directors. I really like Gary Oldman, Barry Kheogan  and Robert Pattinson lately. As well as directors such as  Sofia Coppola, Woody Allen and The Safdie Brothers. My mood changes all the time so dont worry about that. Also no topic is off limits, ill watch anything if its good

I dont believe that Mia Goth has been in any projects with the directors mentioned. However she was in a film with Robert Pattinson, High life (2018) (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4827558/?ref_=nm_flmg_t_8_act). Which was well recieved, however i think Mia Goth has a smaller part so i can suggest a film that she stars in. I would suggest the first of a ongoing trilogy. The film is "X"(2022) (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13560574/?ref_=nm_flmg_t_3_act). I suggest this as she is the main star and seems to fit in with your preferences.
I have seen High Life and enjoyed it alot, which is a good sign. Thank you for providing a film which stars Goth, im excited to watch "X"
What did you enjoy about High Life? Also what makes you excited to watch "X"?
I thought the performances were brilliant in it and the story was very interesting. Also because i love Mia Goth!
Thank you very much for discussing film with me today. I hope you really enjoy my suggestions. Have a lovely day. Thank you. You too.
Thank you, You too .
is there anything else i can help with?
Im looking for a film that i can watch with my nephew
In that case you are looking for a family friendly movie? Does your nephew have any particular interests that might help me make a suggestion?
Yes or anything that is suitable for a 6 year old. Hes very much into Spiderman and the heros and villians that occupy that world.
My Nephew is veyr much into Spiderman and the heros and villians
There are many Spiderman movies which contain villians. Should i include your preference for darker toned movies or should i make it more age appropraite for your nephew
Which of the spiderman films have a darker tone to them but would still be suitable for say a 6 year old boy.
Are there any particular villians he likes alot? Also what other films has he seen that may have darker tones to them? Is he used to movie violence?

I know for a fact he likes Venom or the Green Goblin.  He's seen films such as  The Grinch , A series of Unfortunate Events and Hugo. He has seen some violence such as comic book violence but nothing graphic.

With that information i can provide two suggestions. Firstly i would suggest Spider-man 3 (2007) (https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0413300/) As this film is still for children but has a bit more of a darker tone and also features the villian Venom. Another suggestion could be Spider-Man Into the Spiderverse (2018) 9https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4633694/?ref_=nv_sr_srsg_1_tt_7_nm_0_q_spider-man%2520in) This is a cartoon animated film about spiderman, that i think would be suitable for a 6 year old.

I have personally seen Spider-man 3 and enjoyed it alot but i do think it might not be suitable for my nephew it has some rather dark moments. However the Spiderverse film looks much more suitable for him, also i havent seen it, so it would be fun for both of us

users_mood: interested in darker toned movies that are still child-appropriate

dialogue.message: Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hi there thanks. I need a film recommendation. My family are coming round with young children and I need a family friendly film that is engaging for adults and young children
That sounds great! How young are the children? Is there anything you want to avoid such as violence, horror or bad language?
The children will be between 8 - 12 so if we could avoid anything graphic to spare the blushes of the children and the adults!

My family arent really into films which is why it has fallen to me. I quite like classic directors with a specific style like Martin Scorsese

No - I will bee streaming. I have most of the platforms available. I really like Goodfellas as the dialogue is quite sharp and funny

Sounds great! Have you considered Shark Tale? https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shark_Tale

Martin Scorsese and Robert Di Nero are in the film and it is has a similar style to Goodfellas however it is a family friendly animated film.

Yes -  I wanted something family friendly, but also something that was entertaining so the adults dont get bored and talk over the film. This really annoys the children.
Well I hope this suggestion makes everyone happy. Thank you for using this service and I hope you enjoy the film!
Thanks for your help

users_mood: entertaining for both adults and children

dialogue.message: Hi - I'm hoping you can recommend a film, you did a great job with Shark Tale
Hi! That is great to hear and we would love to help you out again. What reason do you need a recommendation this time and would you like to look at the same director?
My friend is coming over and we would like to watch something still Scorsese but a little bit different
Do you have any specific preferences apart from it being Scorsese
Not really, just that we would want to stay away from the more obvious choices as we have seen most of them before.
Does your friend have any particular interests or preferences? Do you know what they will be in the mood for?
Well, like me they love film but they also really like music and history. I think they will be up for anything

Have you considered The Last Waltz 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Last_Waltz

It is a historical music concert filmed by Martin Scorsese. It isnt widely known as one of his films so might be exactly what you are looking for.
Oh great! I've never heard of this before
Great news! What is it about this that you find the most appealing?
Well, looking at the wiki it looks like there were so many people involved. Plus my friend is a big fan of the band so it will be ideal for us
Brilliant! This should be ideal for you and your friend! Thank you for speaking to me and enjoy the film!
Thank you
Hi, thanks for the Last Waltz recommendation do you have any more?
Hi! Glad you enjoyed it! What are you looking for this time and where will you be watching the film?
I'm going to America and my flight is leaving early in the morning so to help me stay up I thought I would watch a film
Do you have anything in mind like a theme?
Well, I'd like to stick with Scorsese and something quite long would help
Would you like classic Scorsese or something from a more modern era of this director?
I think something classic that I have seen before so I dont have to concentrate to much but is still entertaining

Have you considered Casino
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casino_(1995_film)

It is classic Scorsese and is quite long. As it is set in America it will help get you excited about your trip
Hmm...Ive seen that one quite a bit and quite recently. Do you have anything else?

Have you considered Gangs of New York

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gangs_of_New_York

This was an award winner for Scorsese, is quite long and engaging and will get you excited about your trip
I never thought of this one! Thanks
Is there any particular reason why this film is appealing?
I really like Daniel Day Lewis so anything with him in is great
It is a great film with a great cast. The sets in particular are very impressive. I hope you enjoy the film and thank you for speaking with me.
Thanks for your help
Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hi! i'm looking for advice on what to watch

I want to watch the movie at home but it can be any service, i'm happy to pay for it just for the movie. I like a wide range of genres but enjoy drama the most. I like shows directed or made by women! The only thing i definitely do not want is a movie that has too much violence or action like guns or blowing things up
Do you mind swearing and language or is that okay? Are there any other themes other than too much violence that you want to avoid?
No, i don't mind language and there isn't anything else i want to avoid. I'm okay with some violence just not to the extreme or loads of action as i said above
Will you be watching the movie alone or with others? I know you said you like drama but do you have any other genres you enjoy?
I'm watching alone! I like comedy and romance too
Can i ask why you're watching a movie? Is there a special occasion you want a recommendation for? What kind of mood are you in?
There isn't a special occasion i just want to watch something. I'm in a good mood but tired and i want to watch something that will keep my attention.

i've found a movie i think you will enjoy! This is 'promising young woman'https://www.imdb.com/title/tt9620292/. It's written and directed by a woman which you said you like, and it had drama without being too violent or full of action. It can be watched at home for a`small fee but i know you said you were willing to pay to watch. I'd be grateful for feedback!
That sounds great, thanks! You did listen to my criteria and i think that sounds like a good match for me.
Could you let me know why the movie is a good match for you? What are you looking forward to about this movie?

The movie seems like it has a good plot that is dramatic but it doesn't have any guns, bombs or too much action etc.  It is also directed by a woman. I'm looking forward to finding more out about the main character.
Thank you ever so much for the feedback and letting me know! Have a great day and don't hesitate to come back if you need help again.
Thanks!

Hi! I would be happy to help. What actors or directors do you enjoy? Do you have any specific streaming platforms you enjoy and want to use? Are you watching alone or would you like a recommednation tailored to other peoples tastes as well? What kind of mood are you in, and what kind of movies do you enjoy usually?

I enjoy directors that are female and would love to watch a movie from the same director as your previous suggestion, emerald fennel. I like watching movies that feel women focused and not just about men! I don't mind where i can watch it, any platform is good. I'm watching alone again. I'm in a good mood, happy, and want to watch a movie that is female focused and empowering or relatable. I enjoy movies that are dramatic or comedic.

Okay, great. I looked at Emerald Fennel's other movies and think you would enjoy Barbie, a recent movie. Here is a link to find out more.https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1517268/. It is women focused and has an empowering message that women will relate to. It has some humour and drama so i think you will enjoy it based on the above reasoning. Do you like the suggestion? Thanks!
That sound's perfect for me! i've heard about it but haven't watched it yet. Where can i watch it?
You can watch it on amazon prime for a small fee. What interests you about the Barbie movie, what are you intrigued by?
I'm interested because it's by the same director as the last movie and it seems to have a very female-focused cast and empowering message. I also see it has good reviews.
Great, I'm glad you like my suggestion and thanks for the feedback. Enjoy the movie and have a nice day!
You too! Thanks for the help

Hi! I can help with that. Do you have any current favourite Christmas movies? Who will be watching the movie with you?

I love home alone and i really enjoyed a new one 'your christmas or mine' on amazon last year. I'll be watching with family but since they're all adults it doesn't have to be completely PG, but still more wholesome than some movies.

Since you like 'your Christmas or mine' what about the sequel? Have you seen that yet? It has a 13+ rating so is still more wholesome but great for adults too. It's av available on prime and you can read more about the movie here https://www.imdb.com/title/tt27446495/
I wasn't aware of the sequel but i think that sounds great! I think my family and i will enjoy it.
What do you think you will like about the movie? Why does the suggestion sound like something you would enjoy? Is it the festive theme perhaps or the wholesome rating?
I think i'll enjoy it because it's a festive film, but also because it's a sequel to a film i know i enjoyed. I like that it's wholesome but not childish too.
Thanks for explaining, that makes sense. I'm glad i could help and i hope you have a wonderful Christmas and a wonderful time watching the movie with your family!
Thanks!

yes please

There are plenty of great horror movies you could watch tonight. Which horror sub-genres do you prefer?
I prefer psychological horror, or something spooky about haunted houses and stuff.
All good choices! Is there any content that you'd prefer not to see, such as movies that contain core or are violent?
I don't really like gore. Stuff with sexual violence in it is something I'd rather avoid too.
Absolutely! Which streaming platforms do you have access to? And are you planning to watch the movie alone or are you going to have company tonight?
I'm just having a night in alone and need something to keep me entertained. I have access to Netflix and Amazon Prime.

Based on what you've told me, I would recommend 'The Others'. It's a psychological horror featuring a haunted house, and contains no gore or sexual violence. It's also available on Amazon Prime. I've attached the link to the movie's imdb page. Take a look and let me know what you think. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0230600/

You might also like 'Doctor Sleep', a psychological horror movie released in 2019. I've attached a link with more information. Let me know what you think! https://www.imdb.com/title/tt5606664/

Yeah, another horror movie would be great. I don't really have a favourite actor or anything so I don't mind as long as they're good.

In that case, I would recommend 'Hush', directed by Mike Flanagan and starring Kate Siegel. 'Hush' is a psychological horror-thriller with home-invasion themes. I've attached a link to the movie's imdb page. Check it out and let me know what you think.
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt5022702/

URL: https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/home_alone
Recommendation: Home Alone's is a funny classic festive themed movie that is suitable for all ages. Movie: The Santa Clause
URL: https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/santa_clause
Recommendation: The Santa Clause is utterly undemanding, but it's firmly rooted in the sort of good old-fashioned holiday spirit. Movie: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe,
URL: https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/chronicles_of_narnia_lion_witch_wardrobe
Recommendation: Compelling storytelling, this adaptation stays faithful to its source material and will please moviegoers of all ages. Movie: Paddington,
URL: https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/paddington_2014
Recommendation: Paddington brings a beloved children's character into the 21st century without sacrificing his essential charm, delivering a family-friendly adventure as irresistibly cuddly as its star. Movie: Happy Feet,
URL: https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/happy_feet
Recommendation: Visually dazzling, with a thoughtful storyline and catchy musical numbers, Happy Feet is a great animated movie that offers a family friendly entertaining tale. What do you think about these recommendations?
That seems like a great list of movies! I like the festive theme with them and that they are family friendly. Great!

I like that there is a variety of animated movies, funny movies & family friendly entertainment

Excellent! What are your specific preferences in animated movies? What do you like about them?
I like that animated movies are usually family-friendly, charming, funny & suitable for kids. They are enjoyable to watch together as a family

Thank you!

Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
I'm looking for ideas of a good movie to watch tonight with friends. Do you have any ideas?

We like crime, drama and thriller movies. Maybe something that's based on real life. We don't like newer movies and prefer something a little older.
Can you tell me some movies you've enjoyed in the past?
We recently watched 'A Time to Kill' with Samuel L Jackson and really enjoyed it. Something like that would be great.

We all really like Morgan Freeman. Matthew McCoaughey is popular too.

I'd recommend 'The Shawshank Redemption'. It's a 1994 movie starring Morgan Freeman, about men in a prison. It's gritty but also uplifting. Here's the IMDB link so you can learn more; https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0111161/
This looks great. I've heard great things about this movie, but never had a chance to watch it. Do you know how long it is?

It's about 2 hours and 20 minutes long, so it's quite long. But it's a very engrossing movie and it doesn't feel like it drags. If you enjoy crime and drama movies from the 1990s, I think you'll really enjoy this one. Here's the Wikipedia link so you can learn more; https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Shawshank_Redemption
I'll suggest it to my friends. I'm sure they'll agree. Do you have any other recommendations?

How about 'The Green Mile'? It's another adaptation of a Stephen King novel set inside a prison. It explore the life of the prison guards and their feelings as they put an innocent man to death. Here's the IMDB link so you can learn more; https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0120689/
Oh, I've read the book and I enjoyed it. This is great. So I have two movies I can suggest to my friends.
I'm so pleased you found my recommendations helpful. I hope you enjoy your movie night!
We will! I might come back to you again for more suggestions.

I'll be watching at home with my girlfriend this time.

He is a very good actor! I'm glad you found my recommendation helpful. I hope you enjoy your movie night with your girlfriend!

dialogue.message: Hi there! I need some movie recommendations from you once again. Can you help?
Hi there, of course I can help. Who are you planning to watch movies with? Or are you planning to watch alone?
I have to look after my nephews and nieces tomorrow evening. I need recommendations for movies that will keep kids aged 6 and 8 entertained!
OK, no problem! Do you know much about the kind of things they like to watch or play in their spare time? Have you heard them talk about any favourite movies?
I'm not too sure because I don't spend too much time with them. What are some of the most popular kids movies of 2023?

Some of the most popular kids movies of 2023 include The Little Mermaid, The Super Mario Bros Movie, Spy Kids; Armaggedon and Chicken Run: Dawn of the Nugget. Do you think they might like any of those?
The Super Mario Bros movie could be a good choice. I know they both love video games! Did that movie get good reviews?
It did get good reviews from both critics and moviegoers. It has a score of 7/10 on IMDB.
OK that's good to know. It sounds like a great choice, I think my nephews and nieces will love it!
What do you think they'll enjoy about the movie?
Well I know they've played a lot of Mario games. They find both characters really funny and relatable. I heard the movie also has a great soundtrack which I'm sure they'll love too!
It does have a great soundtrack, a lot of reviewers praised it highly! I think you'll enjoy this movie and so will your nephews and nieces.
Thanks so much for your recommendations. You really helped me out!
Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hi there, I was thinking of watching a movie alone tonight as my family are out. Do you have any good action film recommendations?
Of course I do! But first, do you have any content restrictions? I don't want to recommend anything that is unsuitable for you.
I have no content restrictions so you can recommend any action film!
Do you have any specific preference on action films? For example, do you like action comedy films more than action thrillers?
I do really like a thriller to be fair.
What is it about thrillers that you like? Is there something in particular that always leads you back to the genre?
I like thrillers as they usually contain a good balance of action but also drama. I think they tend to have a bit of everything at a fast pace and that's why I always choose them.

If you haven't watched it already, I recommend watching Seven! Here's a link to the imdb page for more info - https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0114369/?ref_=sr_t_3 . This is a great choice as it contains several action scenes as well as a serious and slightly scary storyline. It also has some fantastic acting from the likes of Brad Pitt and Morgan Freeman! - 2001: A Space Odyssey: one of the slowest films of all time which is extremely philosophical and about a crew of scientists travelling to Jupiter to find evidence of alien life. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0062622
- Moon is a space drama about a lone astronaut on a moon base who is cut off from contact with Earth. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1182345

dialogue.message: Hello there! Allow me to be your personal movie advisor, recommending films you'll love.
Hello. I would like to watch a family movie with my wife and children
Let's find something suitable. How old are your children? Is there anything you would like to avoid in selecting a family movie?
They are 11 and 8. We'd rather not see anything scary or violent, etc, but they are both pretty mature in their tastes.
Can you tell me about your and their preferred movie genres, to better understand their family's movie preferences? What sort of thing have they enjoyed in the past?
We enjoy anime, eg the Studio Ghibli films. That seems to be something which appeals to the whole family.
'Do you have any specific mood or theme in mind for the movie? And how would you like to see it - at the cinema, or do you have any preferred streaming platforms?
We'd be happy to go to the cinema, or to watch on Netflix. As for theme - no, but as above nothing violent or weird, and we are not that interested in superhero etc genres.
If you'd like to go to the cinema I'll need to know your location. For streaming services at home, do you have access to anything beyond Netflix?
We'll be near Hereford in the new year, so cinemas there would be good. We only have Netflix.

For a new release in the cinema, I recommend Hayao Miyazaki's The Boy and the Heron. That is the new and last release by the famed director, whose Studio Ghibli films you have enjoyed in the past. It is gentle and whimsical, though with big life lessons, so it should appeal to the whole family.Here is more information and reviews:
https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_boy_and_the_heron
And here is a trailer:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t5khm-VjEu4

The film is showing at the Odeon multiplex in Hereford in the new year:
https://www.odeon.co.uk/cinemas/hereford/

Are you happy with this recommendation? Your feedback would be appreciated.
Thanks. That looks great. In case we need other choices, can you make a back up recommendation?

If The Boy and the Heron doesn't work out, you could try watching any other Studio Ghibli film on your Netflix subscription. They are all available there.

For a movie with a gentle theme, try
Ponyo;
https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/ponyo
My Neighbour Totoro:
https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/my_neighbor_totoro
OK. Thanks for these recommendations; they look useful.
To help us understand your preferences, can I ask what specifically interests you about the recommendations provided, or if there is anything in particular you are looking for in a movie?
These match the specification I gave above - gentle, not too vilent, fits iwth family viewing history, good for all four of us, and available where we will be staying.
Thank you for your feedback. I am glad that my recommendations matched with your specifications. I hope you all enjoy your movie.
Thanks.

users_mood: good for all four of us

dialogue.message: Hello. I'd like to try another movie by the same director as your last recommendation.
Sure. I'll be happy to find you another film by Hayao Miyazaki. Let's get started.  Is this for viewing movies at home, while travelling, or another occasion? Who will be watching this film?
Were happy to watch at home this time. Just my wife and me, so it needn't be as family oriented as your last recommendations.
Is this for any particular occasion, or just relaxing at home? What sort of films does your wife like?
Just to watch at home. We enjoyed The Boy and the Heron so we'd like something similar. My wife likes films with a historical element.

I recommend The Wind Rises. You can read about it here:

https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=&ved=2ahUKEwj7jLGdg56DAxUUQEEAHbGJDD8QFnoECC4QAQ&url=https%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FThe_Wind_Rises&usg=AOvVaw2whvOyDCm4yLa_GTiY-yG0&opi=89978449

It's set in Japan in the years running up to the second world war, so it should suit your tats for anime and for historical drama. It's not too violent, though there are scenes of warfare. 
As before, you can watch it on your existing Netflix subscription.

Please could you let me know whether you are happy with that recommendation?
Yes, that sounds good. What rating is the film?

It's rated PG in the UK.
What specifically interests you in trying this movie? Is there anything in particular that you're looking for in the film's rating?'.
I just wanted to check as it gives an overall sense of the film's tone.  PG is fine.
Thank you - I am glad this suits your tastes. I hope you both enjoy the film.
Thanks.
Hello. I'd like to find a though provoking film to watch with a group of grown up friends on holiday.
Is there anything in particular you are looking for? Would you like a classic film or a new release to watch in the cinema?
I'd be happy to go to the cinema. We will be in Nottingham.

Do your friends have any particular tastes or preferences? If there is something you know they'd like to watch we can try to find it for you. Is there is a special occasion or theme for which you want a movie recommendation?
No special occasion. We all like serious films, or films with an interesting message. Maybe a period drama?

Here's a suggestion which matches your taste: Oppenheimer. It's a thought provoking historical film about the father of the atom bomb. You and your friends should enjoy it. 
You can find information and reviews here:
https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/oppenheimer_2023

This site should help you find screenings in Nottingham:
https://www.cineworld.co.uk/films/oppenheimer/ho00009352

Can I ask if you are happy with this recommendation?
That sounds good. Thanks.
To help us understand their preferences better and provide more tailored recommendations, can you tell me why Oppenheimer sounds right for you?
We like historical films. Atom bombs sound interesting!
I am glad that sounds like a good choice for your group. Thanks, and enjoy your film.
Will do. Thanks.
